title: How An Under 30 Alum Got His Startup’s Technology For Stabilizing Helicopter Baskets Into This Year’s National Defense Authorization Act

title: From Surveillance To Agency: How To Center The Internet On Humanity
description: GLIAnet founder Richard Whitt on how we can redesign the Internet to center on people, not companies.
author: Konstanze Frischen

title: How To Travel The World During Covid-19
description: I built a hack to travel around the world during Covid-19. I wrote this to share it with my fellow explorers around the world currently confined to their homes.
author: Diana Rau

title: ‘Failure Is Not An Option’: How To Lead In A Crisis The NASA Way
description: No movie is perfectly historically accurate, but Ron Howard’s masterful Apollo 13 comes surprisingly close, especially Ed Harris’s Oscar-nominated performance as Gene Kranz, then NASA’s Director of Flight Operations, who utters the movie’s most memorable line: “Failure is not an option.”
author: Gautam Mukunda

title: The Beatles Are 2020’s Biggest Selling Rock Group—Here Are 6 Things You Can Learn From Their Rookie Mistakes
description: Much like a nascent startup, the Beatles’ early career was comprised of a series of failures, culminating in their unsuccessful audition with Decca Records - a misstep that nearly caused the band to call it quits.
author: John Greathouse

title: Here’s What Republicans Are Likely To Propose For The Next Stimulus Package
description: Stimulus checks, unemployment benefits, and funds for testing and schools are all on the line.
author: Lisette Voytko

title: CEO Brad Paterson Of Fintech Upstart Splitit On The Future Of E-commerce, Payments, Fintech, And BNPL (By Now, Pay Later)
description: Brad Paterson, CEO of Splitit, a Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) fintech solution is interviewed on the future of fintech, BNPL, payments, and eCommerce by customer experience expert Micah Solomon
author: Micah Solomon

title: Google Announces Recipients Of Partnership With American Library Association To Build Out Entrepreneurship Hubs In Underserved Communities
description: This morning, Google announced it will provide thirteen libraries across the country with funding, totaling $1.3 million, to build out a training program for small business owners and entrepreneurs in their communities.
author: Michela Moscufo

title: Entrepreneurs: How To Become A Better Problem-Solver (In Less Than 24 Hours)
description: Are you an entrepreneur looking to take your business-building skills to the next level? If so, the next one you might want to zero in on is that of problem-solving. And while putting forth your best problem-solving self will likely take a lifetime, improvement in a day's time is possible.
author: Pia Silva

title: Republicans Agree On $1,200 Checks, But Negotiations Are Still Faltering. Here’s The Latest On The Next Big Stimulus Bill
description: As benefits expire, rent comes due, the school year looms and states struggle, Washington’s warring factions are racing to rescue the economy and their political fortunes.
